ext_descriptions.ext_description: A model_parameter_type lists the valid qualifiers of a model parameter types.
specifies a string type;
specifies a boolean type;
specifies a logical type;
specifies a numeric type;
specifies a physical type;
A signal_flow_direction lists the valid qualifiers of a ...
specifies that direction is unknown;
specifies that direction is not applicable;
specifies that direction is output direction;
specifies that direction is input direction;
specifies that signal flow is bidirectional;

ext_description.p: A Analytical_model_port_assignment is the relationship between an and the .
ext_description.note: Usually a simulation model is associated on a one to one basis with the .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the assigned_item specifies the whose port is to be associated with an in a .
the assigned_analytical_model_port specifies the that is to be associated with a in a .

ext_description.p: the associated_analytical_model_application specifies the role of the for the Analytical_model_port_assignment.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the assigned_analytical_model_port, assigned_item and associated_analytical_model_application shall be unique within a population of the Analytical_model_port_assignment.
of assigned_analytical_model_port shall be of associated_analytical_model_application.

An Analytical_model_application is a type of Representation. An Analytical_model_application is the association of specific data to an in order to unambiguously characterize some behaviour of a real or imaginary object. The behaviour exhibited by the model in a specific environment or for a range of environments for a specific experiment is an analog of behaviour exhibited by the real or imaginary object when subjected to operational conditions.
Specific expectations for the correlation of the behaviour exhibited by the model and the behaviour of the object modeled may be identified by assigning requirements to the model.
the analytical_model_application_name specifies the string for the human-interpretable identifier for this .
the model_representation specifies the as the basis model for the .

ext_description.p: the model_parameter_assignment specifies the role of the for the . The model_parameter_assignment binds instance data to data slots in the . There shall be one or more for the .
ext_description.note: For each parameter declared in a model definition, an actual value must be assigned when that model is referenced, unless there is a default assignment included in the source code for the model.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: The analytical_model_application_name shall be unique within a population of .

ext_description.p: An Across_port_variable is a type of . An Across_port_variable maps a unit to an interface point for an and assigns an identifier to the mapping. This standard does not enumerate a fixed list of allowed "across unit". A unit is required.
ext_description.note: Physical macro level models require across variables to occur in pairs but that is not formalized in this standard.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: The inherited from shall exist.
An Analog_analytical_model_port is a type of that defines an analog context. An analog context is a context where the domain values are not a discrete, enumerated set of values.

ext_description.p: the signal_variable is an inverse relationship that specifies one or more upon which the Analog_analytical_model_port is existence dependent.
ext_description.note: A port may have more than one signal variable because so-called "through" and "across" variables are properties of the same analog port. Reference: http://icosym.cvut.cz/course/

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
An Analytical_model_definition is a type of .
An Analytical_model_definition is a mathematical description of the properties of a system.
In this part of ISO 10303 an Analytical_model_definition includes the variable declarations of the mathematical description but may not include the assignment of actual values for the variables declared. Assignment of actual values is accomplished in
This part of ISO 10303 provides support for computer systems to verify type consistency between product data defined in this part of ISO 10303 and product data captured by Analytical_model_definitions.
This part of ISO 10303 describes the interfaces (ports) to an Analytical_model_definition and provides support for type checking of the units used for the parameters that may be assigned values for an Analytical_model_definition.
Figure 1 is an example of the case where actual values are not included: the Analytical_model_definition for a resistor that is coded in pseudocode.
Analytical_model_definition of a resistor
When the Analytical_model_definition is referenced by an , literals will be supplied for parameters declared in the interface and the simulator must ensure that types are compatible.
Usually the system is exercised in experiments to evaluate the usefulness of the system in the intended application.
The language syntax and semantics of an Analytical_model_definition are not specified by this part of ISO 10303.
This part of ISO 10303 provides complete support for exchange of units, including SI units, derived units, and user declared units.
This part of ISO 10303 provides complete support for prefixes of units.

ext_description.p: the of which the provides a characterization

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the parameter is an inverse relationship that specifies the role of the for the . There shall be one or more for a particular . Figure 1 illustrates the use of parameters.
the access_mechanism is an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the as its . There shall be one or more for an .
the source_code specifies the role of the for an . The source_code contains the source code for the . Figure 1 illustrates how a source_code is specified and coded.
the reference_document specifies the role of the for the . The reference_document includes interface specifications for Analytical_models of interest to the enterprise.

ext_description.p: the representation_language specifies the that defines the semantics and syntax of the computer interpretable strings in which the will be encoded. Figure 1 illustrates how the representation_language is specified and coded.
ext_description.note: Only representation_languages that use characters from the ASCII code are supported by this part of ISO 10303.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: An Analytical_model_make_from_relationship is a type of . An Analytical_model_make_from_relationship establishes a relationship between an analytical model selected for reuse and the new analytical model that results from the reuse.
the resultant_model specifies an that is the result of the reuse for the Analytical_model_make_from_relationship.
the reusable_model specifies an to be used for the Analytical_model_make_from_relationship.
The reusable_model shall not be the resultant_model.
The combination of reusable_model and resultant_model shall be unique within a population of Analytical_model_make_from_relationship.

An Analytical_model_parameter is a type of . An Analytical_model_parameter is a formally declared variable of the provided for an external application to populate at execution time in a computing environment.
In Spice, temperature is a Analytical_model_parameter that may be set at the execution time.
the accessed_analytical_model is the analytical model for which the parameter is being established.
The combination of the and accessed_analytical_model shall be unique within a population of Analytical_model_parameter.

ext_description.p: An Analytical_model_port is a supertype of , , or . An Analytical_model_port may be an , or additionally may be a . An Analytical_model_port describes an interface point for an .
ext_description.note: These points are the points at which a simulator allows a user to stimulate an application of an or to evaluate the response of an application of an to a stimulus in an experiment. In this context, application includes the reference to the and the literals required for the parameters as provided by a member of . A simulator that enforces conservative laws enforces that the energy entering an application of an must be the same as that leaving the same applicaton of the . The structure of the port is not visible merely by accessing this information. The subtypes of this object provide more visibility into the underlying structure as appropriate. Members of the subtype tree of this object are populated as needed by an application in order to disclose the appropriate level of detail. The specialization in the subtypes of this object occur as a result of being more specific about certain properties of the port.

ext_description.p: the port_name specifies the string that represents an identifier, understandable by the end user, for this Analytical_model_port.
ext_description.note: The port_name is documented in the for the .

ext_description.p: the accessed_analytical_model specifies the that contains this Analytical_model_port.
ext_description.note: Containment in this case explicitly states that if a member of is deleted from the information base then the members of Analytical_model_port that are contained in that member of are also deleted.
Containment in this case also explicitly states that the visibility of the name of an Analytical_model_port is limited to the that is the accessed_analytical_model.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: The combination of the port_name and the accessed_analytical_model shall be unique within a population of Analytical_model_port.
An Analytical_model_port_make_from_relationship is a make from relationship of the original and altered port for the analytical model.
the resultant_feature specifies an for the Analytical_model_port_make_from_relationship.
the reusable_feature specifies an for the Analytical_model_port_make_from_relationship.
the associated_make_from specifies an for the Analytical_model_port_make_from_relationship.
The reusable_feature shall not be the resultant_feature.
The referenced by the reusable_feature shall not be the referenced by the resultant_feature.
The combination of reusable_feature and resultant_feature shall be unique within a population of Analytical_model_port_make_from_relationship.

ext_description.p: An Analytical_model_scalar_port is a type of that has a size of exactly one. The Analytical_model_scalar_port is used if there is a requirement to specify the cardinality of the ports associated by a relationship entity.
ext_description.example: Some examples are in the allocation to a functional unit terminal definition for analysis, or in mapping between a distributed model and a lumped equivalent circuit model, or in mapping to a vector port specified in an external syntax.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: The port size shall be one.
Analytical_model_scalar_port shall contain self as the only item of inherited from .

ext_description.p: An Analytical_model_vector_port is a type of that has a size greater than one. An Analytical_model_vector_port may be an . The Analytical_model_vector_port is used in the converse case to the . This part of ISO 10303 does not predefine the elements of a vector port.
ext_description.note: The cardinality of the structured port is known and a list of names is specified for it.
ext_description.example: Examples are bus ports, multi-degrees-of-freedom connections, microwave domain modes, and address and data bus definitions.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the size specifies the integer for the cardinality of the Analytical_model_vector_port.
the element_port specifies a role of the for the Analytical_model_vector_port.

A Digital_analytical_model_port is a type of that defines a digital context. In this part of ISO 10303, a high impedance port state is considered to be a value assigned during a simulation and is not a type declaration. It is represented by a string value assigned in accordance with the language reference manual. In the case that four state logic is used for simulation, that is "zero", "one", "unknown", "inactive" the string property type shall be declared as ISO 10303-11 does not define four state logic. Other more complex valued logic shall also use string property type declaration.
The Signal_specification provides a mechanism to assign specific experimental values captured in Signal_property to an application of a Digital_analytical_model_port in a functional netlist context. Specifically, the Signal_specification applies values to a Functional_unit_terminal which provides the required facility to declare the logical value of the terminal independent of the signal value on the network node.
A Signal_specification may declare that the Functional_unit_terminal with an identifier of "output_valid" is "inactive" for the same event or at the same time mark that the Signal_specification for the network node the terminal is assigned to is declared to be a "true" value.
The Signal_arm.Signal_property provides a mechanism to exchange experimental values of the time or event dependent data.
the port_type specifies the for the Digital_analytical_model_port. The port_type specifies one of a boolean_property_type, a logical_property_type, or a string_property_type.

the nominal_signal_flow_direction specifies the for the Digital_analytical_model_port. The nominal_signal_flow_direction specifies either BIDIRECTIONAL, INPUT_DIRECTION, OUTPUT_DIRECTION for the Digital_analytical_model_port.
NOT_APPLICABLE is not an allowed value for nominal_signal_flow_direction.
NUMERIC_PROPERTY_TYPE is not an allowed value for port_type.
PHYSICAL_PROPERTY_TYPE is not an allowed value for port_type.
UNKNOWN_DIRECTION is not an allowed value for nominal_signal_flow_direction.

ext_description.p: An Analog_port_variable is one of a , or an , or a . An Analog_port_variable maps a unit to an interface point for an and assigns an identifier to the mapping.
ext_description.note: When modeling physical systems at the macroscopic level, energy equations demand the ability to specify a through variable and an across variable for the same port.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the unit_of_measure specifies the string for the descriptive label for the unit of measure of the value of a property associated with the simulated physical phenomenon exchanged through a member of the Analog_port_variable. The unit_of_measure need not be specified for a particular Analog_port_variable. The representation of the unit_of_measure is in accordance with ISO 10303-41.

ext_description.p: the variable_name specifies the string that represents an identifier, understandable by the end user, for this Analog_port_variable.
ext_description.note: The variable_name is documented in the for the .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the associated_port specifies the that contains this Analog_port_variable.
The combination of the variable_name and the associated_port shall be unique within a population of Analog_port_variable.
A Terminal_pair_port_equivalence_relationship is the assignment association between a pair of scalar ports and a single distributed port.

ext_description.p: the scalar_ports specify the two in the ordered sequence for the Terminal_pair_port_equivalence_relationship. The second scalar port is always the reference port. Other details depend on the specific domain of the .
ext_description.example:
Port "INPUT" of a microwave coaxial filter model is the equivalent_port for this example.
Port "INPUT center pin" is the first for this example. Port "INPUT shield" is the second for this example.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the equivalent_port specifies the that represents the single distributed port for the Terminal_pair_port_equivalence_relationship.
Size of of scalar_ports shall be two.

ext_description.p: A Through_port_variable is a type of . A Through_port_variable maps a unit that is identified as a "through unit" to an interface point for an and assigns an identifier to the mapping. This standard does not enumerate a fixed list of allowed "through unit". A unit is required.
ext_description.example: An is a "through unit". A temperature is an "across unit". Reference: ISO 10303-41

ext_descriptions.ext_description: The inherited from shall exist.

ext_description.p: A Transform_port_variable is a type of . A Transform_port_variable may map a unit to an interface point for an . This standard does not enumerate a fixed list of allowed "transform unit".
ext_description.example: A Laplace transform based would use a Transform_port_variable as the for input and output ports.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the nominal_signal_flow_direction specifies either INPUT_DIRECTION, OUTPUT_DIRECTION, or UNKNOWN_DIRECTION for the Transform_port_variable.
NOT_APPLICABLE is not an allowed value for nominal_signal_flow_direction.
BIDIRECTIONAL is not an allowed value for nominal_signal_flow_direction.
An Analytical_model is a type of .
There shall be one and only one with 'analytical model' associated with an instance of Analytical_model through an instance of .
An Analytical_model_application_assignment is a mean to assign an for use in a network analysis.
the assigned_analytical_model specifies a role of the for the Analytical_model_application_assignment.
the assigned_item specifies a role of the for the Analytical_model_application_assignment.
An Analytical_model_version is a type of .
the of_product specifies a role of the for the Analytical_model_version.
A Digital_analytical_model_vector_port is a type of and

the data_encoding_method is an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Digital_analytical_model_vector_port is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Digital_analytical_model_vector_port as its .
The inherited from shall be .
